summary: The Performing Artist Tax Parity Act of 2025 seeks to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to benefit performing artists. It increases the adjusted gross income limitation for above-the-line deductions, introduces a phaseout based on income levels, and clarifies that commissions paid to managers/agents are deductible. It also increases the threshold for determining nominal employers and includes cost-of-living adjustments for the threshold amounts. The bill's amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
